body.name: The Holy Science
body.description: The original serialized version was published in 1894 and then privately in 1920. The purpose of this audiobook is to show as clearly as possible that there is an essential unity in all religions; that there is no difference in the truths inculcated by the various faiths; that there is but one method by which the world, both external and internal, has evolved; and that there is but one goal admitted by all scriptures. But this basic truth is one not easily comprehended. The discord existing between the different religions, and the ignorance of men, make it almost impossible to lift the veil and have a look at this grand verity. The creeds foster a spirit of hostility and dissension; ignorance widens the gulf that separates one creed from another. Only a few specially gifted persons can rise superior to the influence of their professed creeds and find absolute unanimity in the truths propagated by all great faiths. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: What a beautiful conceptI love Sri yukteswarji from reading yogananda, I love kriya practice and abiding in kutastha. And I love the connections that this beautiful yogi introduces to us with such stunning clarityDid you ever notice that Krishna and Christ were both born yogis, both of them knowing their full well their connection to the source of infinite intelligence?Both of them blowing their parents minds and attracting all kinds of loving devotion. They even have nearly the same nameUnfortunately one of them was born in the wrong part of the world for these kind of hi-jinx and paid the price

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Profound Eternal Wisdom
reviews.reviewText: Although the original work is short, simple and sweet, it does not fail short of deep profoundness. Thus, one must savor each sutra as one contemplates the profound depths of each sentence to integrate the magic hidden within the words. The best way to read this is by allowing time and concentration to reveal the hidden gems.

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Holy Science
reviews.reviewText: What's not to like? One of my favorite books. Some typos, but still awesome!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars very deep spiritual wisdom
reviews.reviewText: This book is probably not for the novice spiritual reader. It succinctly encapsulates universal and perennial wisdom. One sutra could meditated on for a year and one would only begin to scratch the surface of what is available in it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I’m not worthy to write a review but….
reviews.reviewText: How can I review a book by Parmahansa Yogananda’s guru and even come close to the cosmic knowledge and lessons this man taught? I’m reading it for a second time and will say it’s thick with intense information. Some not to intense. If your into yogi’s from India then for sure get this book. Just knowing the words came from his brain to the page for us to read is reason enough.
Demostra o principio comum a todas as religiões. Deus é um só. E o objetivo do ser humano é reunir-se com Ele.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: If you know you know. Sri Yukteswar is a very wise sage. He shares his astronomical knowledge in this book. He also shares his rules for success on how to become a proper yogi. His words are bold and to the point just like how he was when he was Yogananda’s guru! This makes reading quick and easy unlike some old Indian texts that unfortunately seem to go on forever saying the same thing over and over again for 5000 pages. Straight to the point. He shares his love for the bible too! Great read, very thin book can easily finish in a couple of hours but worth it for the knowledge. Namaste 🙏

Dieses Buch ist ein Muss für jeden ernsthaften Sucher auf dem spirituellen Pfad der Selbsterkenntnis. Es zeigt, dass die Lehren von Christentum und Hinduismus in ihren Aussagen identisch sind. Obwohl einfach und klar in der Sprache, ist der Inhalt anspruchsvoll. Insgesamt ist es ein Kleinod der spirituellen Literatur.

J'ignorais jusqu'il y a quelques jours le fait que Sri Yukteswar Giri ait publié un livre. Je pense que l'ouvrage est - par lui-même - profondément instructif. Ses commentaires sur l'astrologie et sur les "Yugas" me semblent fort intéressants. Les commentaires établissent également des parallèles saisissants entre l'hindouisme et le christianisme. A priori, il me semble que le grand mérite de cet ouvrage est de vouloir "montrer aussi clairement que possible qu'il y a une unité essentielle dans toutes les religions".
